elements.description:
`cms-token`
Render and process a shortcode / token from a content management system.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Loading state

properties.name: token
properties.description: Token changed (somehow) do the token processing.

properties.name: tokenEndPoint
properties.description: Token end point updated, change the way we do processing.

properties.name: bodyData
properties.description: Body data which is just token with some encapsulation.

properties.name: _clickInvoked
properties.description: internal tracking for edit button being clicked in HAX presentation

properties.name: tokenData
properties.description: Token data from the end point.

properties.name: tokenPrefix
properties.description: Prefix for the token to be processed

properties.name: tokenSuffix
properties.description: Suffix for the token to be processed

methods.name: _handleTokenResponse
methods.description: Handle the response from the token processing endpoint

methods.name: _windowVisibilityChanged
methods.description: Window visibility callback to monitor when we are being seen

methods.name: __tokenClicked
methods.description: Notice a click on our edit button and set a flag.

methods.name: attached
methods.description: Attached to the DOM, now fire.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Loading state

attributes.name: token
attributes.description: Token changed (somehow) do the token processing.

attributes.name: token-end-point
attributes.description: Token end point updated, change the way we do processing.

attributes.name: body-data
attributes.description: Body data which is just token with some encapsulation.

attributes.name: token-data
attributes.description: Token data from the end point.

attributes.name: token-prefix
attributes.description: Prefix for the token to be processed

attributes.name: token-suffix
attributes.description: Suffix for the token to be processed

elements.description:
`cms-entity`
Render and process a  / entity from a content management system.

properties.name: loading
properties.description: Loading state

properties.name: entityType
properties.description: Type of entity to load

properties.name: entityId
properties.description: ID of the item to load

properties.name: entityDisplayMode
properties.description: Display mode of the entity

properties.name: entityEndPoint
properties.description: entity end point updated, change the way we do processing.

properties.name: bodyData
properties.description: Body data which is just entity with some encapsulation.

properties.name: entityData
properties.description: entity data from the end point.

properties.name: entityPrefix
properties.description: Prefix for the entity to be processed

properties.name: entitySuffix
properties.description: Suffix for the entity to be processed

methods.name: _handleEntityResponse
methods.description: Handle the response from the entity processing endpoint

methods.name: attached
methods.description: Attached to the DOM, now fire.

attributes.name: loading
attributes.description: Loading state

attributes.name: entity-type
attributes.description: Type of entity to load

attributes.name: entity-id
attributes.description: ID of the item to load

attributes.name: entity-display-mode
attributes.description: Display mode of the entity

attributes.name: entity-end-point
attributes.description: entity end point updated, change the way we do processing.

attributes.name: body-data
attributes.description: Body data which is just entity with some encapsulation.

attributes.name: entity-data
attributes.description: entity data from the end point.

attributes.name: entity-prefix
attributes.description: Prefix for the entity to be processed

attributes.name: entity-suffix
attributes.description: Suffix for the entity to be processed

properties.name: openDefault
properties.description: Default the panel to open

properties.name: hideExportButton
properties.description:
Hide the export button, showing it is good for developers
or those doing QA testing of new elements.

properties.name: hidePanelOps
properties.description: Hide the panel operations (save and cancel),

properties.name: hidePreferencesButton
properties.description: Hide preferences button

properties.name: align
properties.description: Direction to align the hax edit panel

properties.name: allowedTags
properties.description:
allowed Tags, usually as dictated by the input filtering
layer of the backend system that HAX is riding on.
While not fullproof, this at least will enforce front-end
filtering to match what actually is going to be allowed
to be saved in the first place.

properties.name: endPoint
properties.description: Location to save content to.

properties.name: method
properties.description: Method to save content.

properties.name: updatePageData
properties.description: Page data, body of text as a string.

properties.name: appStoreConnection
properties.description: Connection object for talking to an app store.

properties.name: bodyOffsetLeft
properties.description: Offset from the left of the body field

properties.name: editMode
properties.description: State of the panel

properties.name: syncBody
properties.description: syncBody

properties.name: bodyValue
properties.description: Only available if syncBody is true; this allows data binding to the value being worked on in hax-body tag

properties.name: hideMessage
properties.description: Flag to hide the toast.

properties.name: redirectLocation
properties.description: Optional URL to redirect to once we save.

properties.name: redirectOnSave
properties.description: Option to redirect once we save successfully

properties.name: activeHaxBody
properties.description: Reference to activeBody.

methods.name: _activeHaxBodyUpdated
methods.description: Ensure we've imported our content on initial setup

methods.name: _computeRedirectOnSave
methods.description: Calculate if we have anywhere to redirect to.

methods.name: _attachDom
methods.description: Break the shadow root for this element (by design)

methods.name: _noticeTagChanges
methods.description: Set certain data bound values to the store once it's ready

methods.name: _storeReady
methods.description: Set certain data bound values to the store once it's ready

methods.name: attached
methods.description:
Attached to the DOM; now we can fire event to the store that
we exist and are the thing being edited.

attributes.name: open-default
attributes.description: Default the panel to open

attributes.name: hide-export-button
attributes.description:
Hide the export button, showing it is good for developers
or those doing QA testing of new elements.

attributes.name: hide-panel-ops
attributes.description: Hide the panel operations (save and cancel),

attributes.name: align

attributes.name: allowed-tags

allowed Tags, usually as dictated by the input filtering
layer of the backend system that HAX is riding on.
While not fullproof, this at least will enforce front-end
filtering to match what actually is going to be allowed
to be saved in the first place.

attributes.name: sync-body
